name: European Textile Services Association
goal: The European Textile Services Association (ETSA) is a non-profit making organisation which was set up in Brussels in 1994 to represent and promote the interests of textile service industry leaders in Europe. The textile services industry has an estimated turnover of circa €12 billion and employs over 135 000 persons in the EU. Textile services provide a sustainable alternative to disposables, washing at home and ownership of textiles. ETSA is the platform for networking and sharing of best practices for its 36 members: leading textile rental and supplier firms, national associations and research institutes. ETSA proactively monitors and lobbies on EU legislation and technical standards on its’ members behalf.
interests: Business and Industry, Consumers, Environment, Food Safety, Research and innovation, Single market, Transport
euInitiatives:
PPE Directive and resulting technical standards for product certification
Medical device Directive and resulting technical standards for product certification
Green public procurement criteria and ecolabel for textiles, detergents and facility management
Textile labelling
Environmental policy: emissions, water, resource saving, waste...
Energy efficiency Directive
Circular economy and subscription based services
Food hygiene
